sentences.en: A gas in thermal equilibrium has particles of all velocities.
sentences.cn: 处于热平衡的气体,其粒子有一切速度.

sentences.en: Another limitation is the lack of availability of accurate equilibrium constants.
sentences.cn: 平衡计算的另一局限性是缺乏准确的可利用的平衡常数.

sentences.en: Any disturbance to the body's state of equilibrium can produce stress.
sentences.cn: 对身体平衡状态的任何干扰都可能产生压力。

sentences.en: Change in the world around us disturbs our inner equilibrium.
sentences.cn: 我们周围世界的变化扰乱了我们内心的平静.

sentences.en: Criticism of equilibrium conditions just set out is based upon two considerations.
sentences.cn: 对于刚才所述的均衡条件的批评考虑到两点理由.

sentences.en: For the economy to be in equilibrium, income must equal expenditure.
sentences.cn: 经济要达到平衡，收支必须均衡。

sentences.en: He had recovered his equilibrium and even his good humour, somehow.
sentences.cn: 不知怎的，他已经恢复了平静，连心情也变好了。

sentences.en: I paused in the hall to take three deep breaths to restore my equilibrium.
sentences.cn: 我在大厅里停了一下，深吸了三口气以恢复平静。

sentences.en: In either case, the body does not remain in equilibrium.
sentences.cn: 无论哪一种情况, 物体都不再保持平衡.

sentences.en: Lame - Maxwell equations of equilibrium have important applications in photoelasticity.
sentences.cn: 拉密 - 麦克斯韦平衡方程在光测弹性力学中具有重要的作用.

sentences.en: Only a steady state, or pathway equilibrium, is reached.
sentences.cn: 所能够达到的只不过是恒态性的平衡.

sentences.en: Some melt carry - over improves the wetting and equilibrium growth conditions.
sentences.cn: 在其中携带一点熔体会改善浸润情况和平衡生长条件.

sentences.en: Statical equilibrium means that both forces and moments are in balance.
sentences.cn: 静态平衡意味着力和力矩都处于平衡.

sentences.en: Stocks seesawed ever lower until prices found some new level of equilibrium.
sentences.cn: 股票在震荡中进一步下跌，直到股价达到某个新的平衡点。

sentences.en: The government is anxious not to upset the economic equilibrium.
sentences.cn: 政府急切希望不要打乱经济平衡。

sentences.en: This is best expressed in the form of an equilibrium constant.
sentences.cn: 这最好用平衡常数的形式来表示.

phrases.tran_cn: 平衡温度；稳定温度；平稳状态温度

trans.tran_en: a balance between different people, groups, or forces that compete with each other, so that none is stronger than the others and a situation is not likely to change suddenly
